text: my name is Sarah Mitchell and I lead the
solutions architecture team for AWS
working with UK wide enterprise
financial services customers so if
you're getting started with security on
AWS there are three things I would think
about firstly the AWS platform offers
you the same tools and techniques that
you would have in your own data center
and you can implement those to fit
whatever security requirements you have
secondly it's really important to
remember that you've got a shared
responsibility model on the AWS platform
we will honor and keep secure the
infrastructure and the configuration
that you apply but you are responsible
for that configuration so that it
matches your requirements and also you
retain complete control over your data
so it's up to you how you implement and
secure that data and we have no
visibility on that the final tip I would
offer for people getting started with
security on AWS is to think about a
culture of security inside your
organization what does it mean to each
and every person involved in an IT
project to think about security all the
way through that project and and apply
that that knowledge to the work that
they're doing and so at the end of the
day everybody can take responsibility
for security on the platform as an
industry leader awl can help you with
your security and compliance when
running workloads on the platform we
provide a number of services that help
in this regard
one example is AWS cloud trail that
tracks every message and invocation on
the service and and stores those in a
log that you can then query another
example is Amazon guard duty which is an
always-on threat detection service
taking feeds from industry and global
security information the artifact
service gives you self-service access
to all of our audit reports whether that
sock reports PCI reports and you then
able to download those audit reports to
use as part of your audit position other
examples of ways we can help you are at
global compliance center which gives you
information of the key regulatory
obligations around the globe for
different industries especially things
like financial services obligations
where in the UK it might differ from
other parts of the world and we keep
regularly updated white papers on how to
apply AWS services to various security
standards so that you can see how to
implement a secure platform on AWS AWS
builds in multiple regions around the
world and within each region we'll have
multiple data centers supporting your
workloads not only that but we also
build sufficient extra capacity both in
the in the hardware and the data centers
but also in the network bandwidth that
we operate our infrastructure on finally
the service health dashboard allows you
to see the status of every service
across every region that you've deployed
workloads to and this transparency gives
you peace of mind to operate on AWS
[Music]
